channel.title: CNN.com
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Tunisia: Parliament speaker becomes acting president
item.description: Tunisian state TV has reported that Fouad Mebazaa is the country's acting leader, with presidential elections to be held in 60 days. The moves follow unrest that forced former president Zine El Abidine Ben Ali to flee to Saudi Arabia.

item.title: More than 500 dead in Brazil flooding
item.description: It was like a tsunami from the sky in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state as flood water gushed through hill towns and giant boulders catapulted from hillsides instantly crushing cars and houses.

item.title: Stampede kills 100 in southern India
item.description: One-hundred people died and 14 were injured during a stampede near a religious temple in southern India, the home secretary of Kerala state said.

item.title: Obama meets with Pakistani president
item.description: U.S. President Barack Obama will meet with Pakistani President Asif Zardari at the White House on Friday.

item.title: Militants kill policewoman, relatives
item.description: Militants stormed the house of a female police officer in northwest Pakistan on Friday morning, killing her and four relatives, authorities said.

item.title: India to cut troops in Kashmir in 2011
item.description: India plans to cut a fourth of its security forces in the Kashmir region under its control over the next 12 months, the country's home secretary said Friday.

item.title: Police: 8 dead, 17 injured in Bolivia crash
item.description: A traffic crash in Bolivia has killed eight people, police said Saturday.

item.title: Bangladesh: Corporal punishment illegal
item.description: A top court has banned any corporal punishment in schools in Bangladesh, a country where millions of children are exposed to physical abuse, officials said Thursday.

item.title: Moscow raps UK limits on spy suspect
item.description: Russia expressed concern Friday over restrictions by British authorities on Russian national Yekaterina Zatuliveter, who was arrested in Britain several weeks ago on suspicion of spying and faces possible deportation.

item.title: Makeshift bomb kills 7 in Afghanistan
item.description: A makeshift bomb exploded Friday in southeastern Afghanistan, killing seven Afghans, NATO said.
